review_title: LOL Funny and not funny hahaha
one_reviews_text:
Put Simply, this game is AAA. I have just finished the mamoth tutorial of learning the differnt weapons and traps. Its simply frikken awesome!. Reminds me a LOT of Asguards Wrath. Without spolining too much, uts not a top down game... You do play and use your body to fight, in saying that... It is also a top down game. I dont wanna say to much, this is not normaly my type of game, But if you like Asguards Wrath, you will love this. Plus the just random spin off twerks!! hahahahaha, CustomizTION becomes a veronika walk way show casing the latest gremlin fassion. Its by far worth more money then its selling for. GREAT GAME!!!! Thanks developers! Its the small and big things that count hahahaaa. 
Seriosly JUST BUY IT AND FIND OUT.

Hidden gem of a game, although it feels unpolished in some instances, annoying bugs here and there but nothing gamebreaking.
The enviroment and the story are very immersive
I loved this game, the story, the graphics. OOhh, the controls and the way you can interact with everything. Amazing, and I want it to be continued!

I didn't expect much from a free game, they are usually short, but I loved this one! The puzzels were very nice, it took me a little while to figure some of them out, and that is a good thing. I love the little house you spend your time in, it was so cozy. And then the search in the woods for the mask, oh my, I don't wanna spoil anything but that stuff creeps me out hahaha! Indeed the controls took some getting used to, some of the dialogue was too long, especially in the beginning when you just wanna gooooo, you know. And the wall with the tiny drawers was also quite annoying sometimes, how they pop out and sometimes fall and then I forget where it was supposed to be and the stuff goes everywhere lol, but even that was not that big of a deal. I really recommend, especially if you like puzzles like I do.

Really enjoyed that, thanks. Quite difficult at times, making me think I'd have to give up or find a walk through video but I didn't and eventually worked out what to do and how to solve the puzzles. Graphics are pretty low quality but that doesn't matter in the slightest because the game play is so good. That bit in the woods really did send a chill through me. Not had that in any other game. Didn't know that was possible.

Ive only been playing this game a little and I love it, but it Isn't very accessible for some people, you see Im in a wheelchair and can't reach the floor, which is very important in the game to be able to pick up stuff, or I can't reach high enough to grab things. would really like to be able to play more of this game than just the start and i know other people with disabilities would as well, please add a feature so you can grab and move things without having to bend over trying to reach something to far away, like the feature in ocullus home where you can select and move things with something like the force. please do this so people with disabilities can play this game as well. also Ive had this post up for a while and they still haven't done anything about it or contacted me,  changed it to one star hopefully now they respond.
Played great at first but now I can't get it to load. Any ideals?
Good story. Controls a little cluncky. Fun puzzles. Hope for a sequal after passing through the door.

review_title: graphics are A+, gameplay too slow
one_reviews_text:
I had zero graphics issues others mentioned, graphics are beautiful and perfectly smooth on a tethered Quest 2 and fast PC/GPU.

However, the gameplay was too slow. There's long story modes that can't be skipped with very fun gameplay that ends too soon. The story is quite good, but is a drag when it can't be skipped and I just want to do some shooting.
Super awesome. I like the story, I like the puzzles, I like graphics and atmosphere. And for free? Why? ... If you will make similar game, maybe longer I will buy and pay immediatelly.

Absolutely great game.

pros.
.Graphics are fantastic
.Story and universe that the game takes place in are very well developed
.Spell casting system works like a charm
.Puzzles are challenging and fun
.voice acting is great
.Its free!

cons.
.Strange physics glitches
.Animations can be janky or delayed
.no option for smooth turning or movement
.Some of the earlier game mechanics are “dropped”. For example, shaking your head yes and no never appears again after it’s first use.

Notes: This game was a blast to play. The lore, the art, the music, and creativity behind this game were all things that made it great.
Really, my only complaint is game design for the reasons listed above.

Anyone with a vr headset should pick this game up, theres no excuse not to.

Ps. I would love to see the spell casting system implemented into a MMO if thats possible

Also, I would totally read a book that takes place in this games universe. Please tell your story writer to make a short novel or something.

I want to give this game a 5 star review so badly, however, not having a graphics setting to up the pixel density or resolution/textures almost made me have a seizure.  If you guys implement something, i will definitly try it again and change my review.  Thanks anyways.
I absolutely love this game the story was very interesting from start to end and I was completely immersed in this amazing FREE game.

This is a very well made game, the plot is interesting from the beginning to the end. The gameplay is very immersive and vr features are nicely exploited. The puzzles are not impossible but neither trivial, I loved them. The fight part at the end maybe were a bit clunky. The game was not so long, but I would not had added more than half an hour to this plot. Perfect, and FREE. Moreover, after the first hour I switched to free locomotion and had no motion sickness problems at all, since the movement is not too fast.

is thar going 
to be a secwol
but cuse 
i am smal it was hard to 
do sume stuf
solid game in every corner you look at  also its short and Free I give it 10/10
If anything, my only complaint is the game is kinda short. Details, controls, and visuals are all top notch. I would love to see a longer game made for this storyline.
a very good game. fantastic experience

Outstanding game for free. It's a little clunky at times. With a little more development this could be a $20-$30 game and be totaly worth it. I am currently in a spot where it wont get passed a fatal crash. Troubleshooting now.

It's a short but well-designed game. Very interesting and unique mechanics. 
It's amazing that such a thing is free, because it is better than many expensive ones.
Thank!
Great game loved it the puzzles were frustrating at times but that made it all the mroe satisfying when you solve them.
I liked it at first but then things started to disappear. I needed said item and it must have glitched out of the game :(

review_title: All in all a SOLID indie VR game.
one_reviews_text:
I was browsing the Top-Free section, when I came across this game. Looked decent, and since it was free I though, "Sure, why not try a spell casting fighting game". Well, it was so much more then that. 
I won't make this a long review, but all in all I was very plesantly surprised. I came expecting a combat game (and it has it for sure), but I stayed for the story and puzzles. My favorite part about the game was the "Safe Room", and its hidden secrets (LOVED the little alchemical cubby! Wish I could have done more with it!).

I'm very impressed. Heading into the game dev stage myself, I can only say Bravo! to Stormborn Studios, and I hope I have it in me to make something like you have in the coming future. Thank you for a good experience.

I like these types of puzzle game with a hint of adventure and combat throwen in for good measure and that's what this game is.
Don't be misled as to think it is a spell combat game. This is a story driven puzzle game and it does that very well.
I especially like the collison physics and the devs of this got it extremly right. Move something with something and you get the results you prety much would expect which I have seen so many other companies fail at.
The puzzles are good enough to figure out but not taxing enough that you have to google it, which is a big thumbs up from me.
The graphics are very well done. High quality to a point and doesn't burn your graphics card out. The spells, the lighting, the over all look of the game is pleasing to the eye.
The sounds and voice acting are very well done.
The game is not epically long. I completed it within 5 hours tops as I spent a bit of time messing about.
All in all, I very much enjoyed playing this and anyone who llike these style of games will do to.
I just wonder what is next from this company.

review_title: More puzzle game than anything else
one_reviews_text:
This is a good game that teases greatness, but then disappoints. The best part of this game is the story. It looks like it might be an epic open-world adventure at the start or at least an epic linear story game, but it's in fact just a puzzle room interlaced with some menial activities outside of the puzzle / escape room. You learn these awesome-looking & intuitive gesture-based magical attacks, then hardly use them. I finished the game in 3+ hours ... it ends like a prologue to a great game. It leaves you wanting so much more.

You can view my review & gameplay here: https://youtu.be/3u3llUz5uYA

Game seems nice but I'm stuck at the menu environment. When I try to go forward the game takes me to a black screen. I can hear sounds if I cast a spell so the game is still on, but everythings is black screen. Tried to blow the candle in the menu environment to start all over again, but doesn't seem to work... Please help !!!
review_feedback:
I'm so sorry you found a bug. Please let us help you, you can come to our discord for help https://discordapp.com/invite/MdA4qmJ

Also you can find the savedata at Appdata/Localow/stormbrn studio/Runes_The_Forgotten_Path/Roomsavedata.dat

You can also try erasing it from there to restart your game. Let us know.

one_reviews_text: This is not a game about fighting with spells. At least it doesnt MAINLY focus on that. Its a puzzle/adventure game. That might sound discouraging for people who were looking for a decent spell shooter but let me tell you that I was one of those people but after I bought this on a sale I was actually pretty suprised. This is what good VR games look like. A great and logical story with good spellcasting some fights and some puzzles. Its not terribly long which is why I think the price tag is a little too much but thats not for me to decide I quess. The only complaint (The one star missing) is that I was approaching the end of the game, without actually knowing it, and I decided to take a break. When I came back a huge chunk of my progress had been lost which almost made me quit the game completely but thankfully I didnt. Anyway if you do buy this dont be too hard about the length of the game to the devs. They have done something that most companies cant with way less to work with.

I enjoyed the story, voice acting, and the good variety of puzzles which made nice use of VR.  Gesture spell casting was nice and I really liked the different spells. Combat was good but minimal so it you’re looking for more of a fast-paced action game you might be disappointed (I wasn’t). I found all 3 types of locomotion useful at different points in the game and didn’t miss smooth turning.
Some minor issues (eg climbing was a bit hit and miss) and the final fight felt very hard compared to the few easy warmups before then.  However the game allows unlimited retries without having to repeat a load of previous stuff so this wasn't too painful (except for my ego).
I took about 3 hours for my first play-through. I hope for more content in the future as I want to continue playing – it would seem a shame not to get more use out of all the foundations that have been set up.

Good engine and feels natural.  Allows for multiple movement and throwing actions are well done.  Nice to have a story and voice acting.  Can't wait for more content.  

It is short, at writing this, but so are many others.  I would of done 5 starts but items sometimes get jumpy and end up in a random place or gone.  I had to restart once since my hammer and nails i had in a chest decided to explode open and i couldn't find the hammer.

review_title: PCVR at its finest - a must have
one_reviews_text:
Didn't expect much from this game and was blown away. Using a GTX 1080 I forced super sampling 2.0 - and the game started up in solid 90 fps - just amazing. And the textures were real PCVR textures made by skilled artists with details so incredibly small everything just looked real - astonishing! So forget those awful Quest games, this is real PCVR ;-) Somehow I feel like I'm the main character in a play in a giant theater - you're instanty drawn to the story, and it doesn't feel like a game. It feels like an experience - like being there. Or maybe just Mage's Tale for adults ;-) Sound and voice acting are also fantastic, maybe not AAA fantastic, but feel genuine. One thing that could be improved is the controls - while they aren't bad, HMD-directed full locomotion would be better. And an option for smooth turning. There're no video options in the game, but super sampling can be increased by the use of Oculus Tray Tools - and high levels of super sampling make this game truly come alive.
I'm starting to feel a bad conscience for getting this game on sale. The many hours it must have taken the devs to create this gem make this game truly worth its full price. This is a must have for all Rift owners.
I really enjoyed the game, I liked the look and feel,the forest was very nice,the puzzles fun.My only complaint is it was too short,it wasd over too soon.

Pros: 
great graphics, good story, VERY cool ideas/inovations

Cons:
Short (like most VR games honestly), has a few bugs
Before getting stuck up the chimney I didn't like the game.
make a dlc that cost 25 dollars and have more spells like water,wind,earth and a whole new part of the story with a boss fight.

Definately worth it! despite being quite short ( Power played it in just over a couple of hours) it's story and atmosphere is very dence. very well written and voice acted! and the unique spell casting system is pretty cool! 

I do hope there is an expantion on this or a next chapter, the end left me wanting more! If i could suggest something it would definately be faster locomotion and the ability to set it pernamently (keeps resetting after each scene) and of course... MORE CONTENT!!! :D

My congratulations to the developers on this one! may your work continue to bear fruit like this materpiece!!

review_title: Strong story driven VR wizard game.
one_reviews_text: "Wow! Finally a VR game where the story works. And the spells are really cool. I was kind of fed up with beat saber and casual games, as I get bored with them after a while, but this has a solid story, beautiful art and I love the music, it's stuck in my mind for hours after I finished playing it. It took me 4.5 hours to actually finish the game, not so many VR games with a story provide such a long playtime. I would have gone on for another couple of levels, so if you haven't done so yet, please think of a sequel!

The reason why I give it 5 stars.
1. I love games in which you have magic powers.
2. The handling is very easy to learn but you still have to think your way through the game. Its not all hack&slay. 
3.The graphic is good, I have no performance issues and my computer is not state of the art.
4. They put much work in small details, which are not essential to the game but they make it more alive. You can see, that the people were devoted to the project.
5. The price is absolut fair. I have paid more money for early access games, which were never really finished. 
6. You get  almos instant support, when you have a question.  I hope these people will continue to make such good games.

review_title: Really immersive and good voice acting
one_reviews_text: This game reminds me of a Myst type game, and I really enjoyed the aestetic and attention to detail in many aspects. As the title says, the voice acting (there is lots of voice in this game in a good way) is really good and helped make the experience much more immersive. The puzzles were fun and I liked the alchemy system they had. This game took me 4-5 hours, and for a fairly low price that seems totally reasonable to me

So first of all: I love the spellcasting, it is exactly as i want it to be in a VR-game, perfect. The riddles and escape-room like gameplay elements are great (love the smoking pipe). The voice acting sounds pretty decent, better than i heard in some other, more expensive games. 
And now to the 'but...':
Teleportation-movement is something i despise, it is immersion breaking (i get it, people get seasick, stil...), having 'my' body run around in front of me is even worse, but that is just my opinion. At least in a game about magic it has some reasoning (astral body and all that) so okay. Anyways, glad you added smooth locomotion, but is there a way that i don't have to check it in the menu every time i switch between memories and the room? That is very tedious. 
Then i also have a weird affinity to break the game. When the Master teaches you new spells, and i try to move i usually end up either somewhere in the middle of empty nowhere, or outside the room or once in the forest with the shadow guy looking all depressed. Have to go back to main menu then, altough sometimes the book doesn't show up either so i have to close the game. Luckily the gamed saved, but mostly somewhere way before. (Example: Learning Fire arrow -> breaking game -> loading -> end up where you have to do alchemy to create butterlfies.) If you can get that fixed i'll glady change my rating to 5/5.
review_feedback:
Hi! Thank you for your nice review. I just uploaded a new update (1.11 version check if you have it when restarting oculus) that should fix several things with smooth locomotion. It shouldn´t restart it anymore between tutorials, cinematics and gameplay (for now you just have to turn it on when going to the beach or the forest but I am hoping to fix that too). The new update should also fix some of those problems you mention for when going into tutorials. Let me know if you get them again so I can investigate more. Also there is a fix so when doing telekinesis with your left hand you won´t be moving forward at the same time. You can also come in our Discord where we might help you faster : ) https://discord.gg/MdA4qmJ 
Thank you!

one_reviews_text: Game seemed ok, pretty rough in terms of polish but I knew it was an indie game.  I got to my house about 15 minutes in and had to start putting drawers back inside a cabinet.  Then, the game physics went haywire and shot all the objects around the room, including the tablet with the instructions I needed.  Couldn't ever find it again.  Pretty hilarious to watch everything go crazy, but alas, that ended my game, don't really feel like starting over so that's an uninstall.  Maybe it was just an uncommon glitch, but that's my experience with Runes.
review_feedback: Hi, Im sorry you found such an isolated incident. you shouldnt have to restart the whole game though as you can simply go out to the menu and back in and things should be back in place. if we can help you in any way please let us know. we hang out in discord where we can help you https://discord.gg/MdA4qmJ

one_reviews_text:
To imply that this is a full application is not quite honest. This is a 3 hour training session with one battle at the end.  Incredibly disappointing, you learn the fighting skills but never get to practice them until the one final battle.  

I gave it two stars because I liked most of it but I'm so irritated that I won't spend money on the expansions if they come out.
review_feedback: I'm sorry you think that way and gave us such a low score : ( , the game is a story-drive adventure with puzzles, narrative and some fights. Narrative games are really hard to make in VR and if you compare the length to some of the most famous adventure games like "The Gallery" I think you'll find we created something with quite a good length (the fact it felt so short is maybe an indication of how much fun you had?). We have tried to make the best and most passionate job with our small indie studio. Let me know if I can help you in any way for I would love everyone to enjoy the game and be happy about it, our discord is https://discord.gg/MdA4qmJ

one_reviews_text:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ESvXQD89FCY (Please note: links from Oculus are not working so search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR Runes: The Forgotten Path'

My Quick Thoughts:
A lot better than I was expecting.... Impressive worlds with unique puzzles, spell-casting, and story elements.  See my Video above for my full thoughts.

Some of the worst animations i've seen in a game for some time, voice acting was passable but pretty am dram. Graphics are about avarage when compared to other vr titles. I found the gameplay quite dull tbh & some of the interactions & puzzles are very clunky. Overal it felt very unpolished & the price seems high for what you get.
review_feedback: All animations in the game are mocap animations, and all voices are professional actors. If you enjoy adventure games with puzzles, action, unique spellcasting and a deep storyline Runes should deliver that experience.  Join our discord if you want to talk more for I would like to understand such a rough score https://discord.gg/MdA4qmJ

one_reviews_text: Awesome graphics and amazing story

The immersion and the atmosphere of this game is truly amazing! I really enjoy these type of games, especially when there's a nice story and a very well done ambience!!

Absolutely worth it! Congratulations to the developers for making this piece of art. Hope you make MORE of this!!

Soon i will publish a gameplay video of this game, so you can see how it is!

I just finished playing this. I loved it. Really.
The narrative behind this game is gold: I enjoyed it as you would enjoy an awesome tv show you can't wait the second season for. 

The puzzle elements are amazing and, most of all, the details in the environments and objects make you feel as if you're really interacting with a magical world.

The spells turned me into a maniac.

The fights were a little complicated to grasp at first but after your well deserved rounds of deaths, you get the hang of it and start feeling as powerful as Darth Vader.

Finale was ... wow. wow. wow.

Get me part two now.
NOW.
